title: Wand of mindburst

***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| Type | Wand                                                                                        |
| :--- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name | Wand of mindburst                                                                           |
| Icon | [![Wand of mindburst.png](/images/5/52/Wand_of_mindburst.png)](/File:Wand_of_mindburst.png) |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| - | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A magical device which launches a psychic attack on a target creature. If it overcomes their willpower, it 'blows their mind' in a violently literal fashion, dealing damage that bypasses their armour entirely. It is useless against mindless creatures. |

A **wand of mindburst** deals significant chunks of untyped damage to a single monster, assuming it isn't [mindless](/Monster_intelligence "Monster intelligence"). This effect must overcome the target's [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower"), but it ignores [AC](/AC "AC") and always hits. Mindburst is significantly harder to resist than other willpower-related wand effects, making it useful against a large variety of early- and mid-game opponents.

Players will deal `3d(8.75 + 3.5 * Evocations/4)` damage with this wand.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Monsters will deal `1d(12 + (30 + HD)/4)` damage with this wand.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

Players use mindburst with an [enchantment power](/Enchantment_power "Enchantment power") multiplier of x2.5,[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) which makes it much harder to resist than other wands. See the [Willpower](/Willpower#Resisting_enchantments "Willpower") article for more details.

## Contents

- [1 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [2 Trivia](#Trivia)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

## Strategy

- This wand can be particularly effective at taking out low-HD, high-threat monsters such as [boggarts](/Boggart "Boggart") and [Sonja](/Sonja "Sonja").
- Mindburst is also effective at killing low-level players. If an early opponent happens to have one on hand, you'll likely want to escape immediately; multiple zaps of a wand of mindburst can very quickly become lethal.

## Trivia

A monster killed in this manner will explode, spraying blood splatters around the area without leaving a [corpse](/Corpse "Corpse") ([dragons](/List_of_dragons "List of dragons") are immune to this effect, and may or may not leave a corpse as normal). Followers of [Gozag Ym Sagoz](/Gozag_Ym_Sagoz "Gozag Ym Sagoz") will receive a spray of single [gold](/Gold "Gold") coins on several nearby tiles instead of a shower of blood.

## History

- In [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), monsters no longer deal x67% damage with this wand. Instead, mindburst's damage formula (when used by monsters) was reduced. Overall, damage is slightly higher than it was in 0.28.
- In [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), monsters deal x67% damage with this wand. It was supposed to work this way since [0.4](/0.4 "0.4"), but was broken due to a bug.
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), this wand was called the **wand of disintegration**. Also, it could affect [mindless](/Category:Brainless_intelligence "Category:Brainless intelligence") creatures.
- Prior to [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), it could disintegrate [rock walls](/Wall#Rock "Wall") and obstacles in the dungeon ([doors](/Door "Door"), [iron grates](/Iron_grate "Iron grate"), [trees](/Tree "Tree"), orcish idols, and most kinds of [statues](/Statue "Statue")).
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), [orange crystal statues](/Orange_crystal_statue "Orange crystal statue") and [silver statues](/Silver_statue "Silver statue") could be destroyed instantly through use of a wand of disintegration.
- Prior to [0.6](/0.6 "0.6"), zapped creatures were simply reduced to nothingness.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [zap-data.h:1143](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.0/crawl-ref/source/zap-data.h#L1143) (0.30.0)  
   Specifically, you'll deal `3d(5 + pow/4)` damage, for pow = `15 + 3.5 * Evocations` ([evoke.cc:177](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.0/crawl-ref/source/evoke.cc#L177) (0.30.0)). If you have the [MP-Powered Wands](/MP-Powered_Wands "MP-Powered Wands") mutation, then your "pow" gains a +33% boost.
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [zap-data.h:1145](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.0/crawl-ref/source/zap-data.h#L1145) (0.30.0)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [zap-data.h:1144](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.0/crawl-ref/source/zap-data.h#L1144) (0.30.0)
